intro: Hieracium trafoiense, commonly known as the Trafoiense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium trafoiense is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in dry environments.
